results.title: Journey into Thailand
results.brief_description: Travel with Keith Adam as he examines the life and culture of Thailand. Each episode reveals an aspect of this ancient land, its people and history.

results.title: Tales of gods and demons
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Describes the history of the masked ballet performed by Thai dancers. Explains the dance drama Ramakein and the myths and legends from which it originates.

results.title: Lords of the forest
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Keith Adam presents this program which explores the teak forests of Thailand, one of the last places in the world where elephants are still used commercially. It shows an elephant festival, a tug-of-war between an elephant and 150 soldiers and a soccer game played by elephants.

results.title: The Long march south
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This program describes the early history of the Thais. It tells how they came from China migrating over the mountains into Burma and Thailand and how they established their first kingdom by the fifteenth century and moved south when it was destroyed.

results.title: The Middle path
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Keith Adam presents this program which offers a visit to the small market town of Chom Thong which provides a glimpse of life in a Buddhist monastery. It shows how the monastery and the monks play a vital part in the day-to-day life of the town.

results.title: Strength of the land
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This video follows the King of Thailand, Bhumibol Adulyadej, through his many personal and public activities, including his interest in science, agricultural engineering, the arts, and his tours of his country. Narrated by Keith Adam.

results.title: The Other Thailand
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Alan Bateman and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This program, presented by Keith Adam, describes the southern area of Thailand where the majority of the people are Muslim. It explores the industries in the area and the conflicts with the northern Buddhist population.

results.title: Women and spirituality
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This series looks at the forgotten cultures where goddess-worshipping religions were prevalent, civilisations which were egalitaran and were based on human cooperation.

results.title: Full circle
results.creator_credit: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This is a stirring documentary that awakens memories of ancestral roots that connect us to each other and to all living things. It is a journey that looks at some of the manifestations of the modern women’s spirituality movement in the western world. Through contmporary spirituality, whether from Wicca, pagan or indigenous peoples we see people communing with each other or alone. Rituals become gateways that lead to an inner place where twentieth century notions of domination over the earth are replaced with a sense of awe.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Burning times
results.creator_credit: Donna Read, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women and spirituality”.
This beautifully crafted documentary is an in-depth look at the witch persecutions that swept through Europe just a few hundred years ago. False accusations and trials led to extensive torture and burnings at the stake, and ultimatley to the destruction of a way of life that had endured for thousands of years. Of those killed, 85% were women and widespread violence against women, still prevalent today, can be traced back to those times. It investigates the role of the Catholic Church in the crimes and explores the process whereby the old pagan communities, founded on spirituality and cooperation, were transformed into the misogynist capitalist societies of our own century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donna Read, Margaret Pettigrew, Mary Armstrong, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
